adam.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday within work hours 09:00-17:00 that includes all participants

frances.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday within work hours 09:00-17:00 that includes all participants

natalie.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday within work hours 09:00-17:00 that includes all participants

diana.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday within work hours 09:00-17:00 that includes all participants

orchestrator.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday within work hours 09:00-17:00 that includes all participants

public_information: Time slots are in 30 minute increments
There exists at least one time that works for all participants

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language) targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is adam. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->adam->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->adam->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file for FastDownward that encodes your availability constraints and the meeting scheduling goal. If you miss some information do not make assumptions and only encode what you know. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language) targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents keep their actions and constraints distinct.
pddl.prompt: There are multiple agents in an environment that are planning to schedule a meeting. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem but may require integration. Ambiguities may appear for example when agents use different names for the same time slot. Here is the information and PDDL response from each agent. Participant adam and its PDDL: {pddl_adam} Participant frances and its PDDL: {pddl_frances} Participant natalie and its PDDL: {pddl_natalie} Participant patrick and its PDDL: {pddl_patrick} Participant willie and its PDDL: {pddl_willie} Participant diana and its PDDL: {pddl_diana} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of all agents to produce a unified PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that finds a 30 minute slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for everyone. It is important that you keep the agents' availability constraints distinct and traceable. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
